text: the construction bidding simulation is a
model that lets multiple teams compete
with each other to bid for a
construction contract from the point of
view of a general contractor the way
that the simulation runs is that the
students have to pretend they're
assembling a bid for a construction
project and the way that works in real
life is you have to figure out how big
is the building what's the building made
of and then collect all these bids from
various trades like concrete and walls
and windows and those kind of things and
so we simulate the process of having
people figure out the quantities how
much steel how much concrete what kind
of surface area and then receiving
competitive bids as they would come in
in the real world towards a a time
certain on a day when the bid is due
ultimately the conversation is really in
the debrief the simulation isn't that
difficult the debrief is that is the
important part in the debrief you can
talk about things ranging from how did
it feel which usually is pretty tense so
the room gets hot and you'll walk around
then it's just like in real life in the
war room in a bidding situation where
everybody's got their tie loosened and
took their sweater off and they're
trying to figure this stuff out and
ultimately it leads into a discussion of
how to set up a bidding situation which
applies to any market not just
construction and it applies to how do
you set up a contract we wrote this for
the mba class but we tested it three
times an executive education first
because we wanted to see how it worked
we had some unexpected reactions from
people who don't like uncertainty
because there's a lot of chaos I mean
it's different than your normal kind of
controlled case study discussion because
you don't really understand it you don't
know what's going to happen and if you
didn't really do your homework you're
lost well that's kind of the teaching
point if you note to your homework
you're lost
this is definitely met the goals that we
hope for because it's been something
that's been fun and stimulating and
something that's outside of the realm of
what people would would often do
